rComments: confused for all the assignments because she doesn't provide any prompt or direction so u have to ask for clarification on everything: the worst part. DO NOT take this class if ur not obsessed w archaeology/anthropology I took it bc I thought it was about law but we spent 2 hrs talking about the significance of a dining hall smh #gotagoodgradetho
teacherRatingTags: ['Get ready to read', 'Accessible outside class', 'Graded by few things']

rComments: Anne really just wants you to succeed. She gives you plenty of opportunities to do well in the class (you write an essay and do a creative costume project). The exam is super fair, she posts slides and most of the lectures are based on class discussion. That being said I didn't go to class often and I still got an A. Highly recommend.

This course started off a bit dry but ended up becoming one of the best things I've taken all year. I would definitely take another NMC course again. I really liked how we learned different takes on certain artifacts or concepts. The assignments were also very unique and actually fun to do.
teacherRatingTags: ['Gives good feedback', 'Clear grading criteria', "Skip class? You won't pass."]

rComments: True gem. She calls it as she sees it, and is caring. Super excited about her work, and her lectures are great. Best lecture featured her debunking outlandish alien theories re: monumental architecture. Great variety of projects and the final was exactly what she said it was going to be. No textbooks, 2+ articles prep per lecture that you read.
